abstract: United States Military Academy at West Point says it will not punish 16 black female senior cadets who posed for group picture with raised fists, saying gesture did not violate Army regulations forbidding political activities while in uniform; many current and former military personnel say raised fists were inappropriate and divisive sign of allegiance with Black Lives Matter movement.
lead_paragraph: The United States Military Academy announced that the image did not violate Army regulations that prohibit partisan political activity in uniform.

headline.main: West Point Won’t Punish Cadets in Raised-Fist Photo
headline.print_headline: Cadets in Raised-Fist Photo Won’t Be Punished

snippet: The United States Military Academy announced that the image did not violate Army regulations that prohibit partisan political activity in uniform.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
